segments.text: no , but I'm pretty good at eating !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: do you prefer chinese food or Western food ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , to be honest with you , Chinese food is really different from western food .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: are you used to the food here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not really used to it yet .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: like most foreigners , I really like Sweet and Sour Pork and Kung Pao Chicken . I eat them almost every day .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: have you tried traditional Chinese dumplings yet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I tried once , but they are quite difficult to eat with chopsticks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you know , foreigners are not expected to use chopsticks proficiently . If you do , you'll give your Chinese friends quite an impression .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's good to know . I'd like to try more Chinese food , but since I can't read any of the menus in the restaurants near my home , it's difficult to try new food .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: if you want , I can introduce you to some typical Chinese dishes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that would be great . I really only want to taste real Chinese food , not just the food that foreigners like to eat !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: if you haven't tried Beijing duck yet , I'd like to treat you to a meal at a famous duck restaurant near Qianmen . It would be a pity if you left without tasting it !
segments.speaker: S1
